instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar Macbook Pro 5 Volts On Dcin
threads.message:
Hey Duke, working on this touchbar mac I'm so freaking confused on where to start <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is only pushing out 5 v. Where do i start to look for the issue i checked all power rails resistance to ground and cant find any shorts, I need help to understand how this new system works.
Yes its water damaged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar Macbook Pro 5 Volts On Dcin
threads.message:
SMC doesn't communicate with charger...

Do you get 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?
If not, post LDO voltages for CD3215A corresponding of the USB-C port where you connect the charger.

3V3 at L6900?
If not, post some voltages for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> can generate normal voltage at F7000 with 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>.

To get nominal voltage from charger, all CD3215A controllers must boot.
Check for corrosion at <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>; seems to be a common failure for 5V from charger...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar Macbook Pro 5 Volts On Dcin
threads.message: thanks for the info I will check it out and get back to you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar Macbook Pro 5 Volts On Dcin
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 40011"]SMC doesn't communicate with charger...

Do you get 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?
If not, post LDO voltages for CD3215A corresponding of the USB-C port where you connect the charger.

3V3 at L6900?
If not, post some voltages for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> can generate normal voltage at F7000 with 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>.

To get nominal voltage from charger, all CD3215A controllers must boot.
Check for corrosion at <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>; seems to be a common failure for 5V from charger...[/QUOTE]

<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> Voltage is 5v.xx but cycling
LDO voltage for <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> is 3.4XX but is cycling as well
F7000 is 0.52 V No short to ground
no corrosion under <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touchbar Macbook Pro 5 Volts On Dcin
threads.message:
Input voltage at F3000/01, or FB200/01 also fluctuates?
None of all 4 ports stable?

Measure voltages around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> when you get 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>.
Voltage of L6900 at the same moment?
